MC.content: ever since Plato [repression of Democritus, a large symptom?], an organization of the throw: subject/object > repress chance, repress the mark, protect “normality,” isolate a solid context (stereotomy)
MC.linkedContent: ever since Plato [repression of Democritus, a large symptom?], an organization of the throw: subject/object > repress chance, repress the mark, protect “normality,” isolate a solid context (stereotomy)

OOG.content: Husserl: “if science, w/ radical responsibility, has reached decisions they can impress on life habitual norms as volitional bents…from w/in which individual decisions ought…to confine themselves”
OOG.linkedContent: Husserl: “if science, w/ radical responsibility, has reached decisions they can impress on life habitual norms as volitional bents…from w/in which individual decisions ought…to confine themselves”

OOG.content: when horizon becomes structure and essence: horizon normalizes, creates norms
OOG.linkedContent: when horizon becomes structure and essence: horizon normalizes, creates norms

OOG.content: for Husserl, subjectivity “normed” in the Present, “fastened” to a “higher subjectivity,” higher sense investigation
OOG.linkedContent: for Husserl, subjectivity “normed” in the Present, “fastened” to a “higher subjectivity,” higher sense investigation

PAS.content: each pas transgresses the pas [contamination of adverb/noun]; violence of this dislocation, sur une scène tout autre, occurs, increases, when it appears not to displace anything in discursivity, consciousness, in unscathed, assured normality of language [alters subterraneanly]
PAS.linkedContent: each pas transgresses the pas [contamination of adverb/noun]; violence of this dislocation, sur une scène tout autre, occurs, increases, when it appears not to displace anything in discursivity, consciousness, in unscathed, assured normality of language [alters subterraneanly]

GSP.content: in late Husserl, [quasi-Hegelian teleological reason] movement of meaning can only be a norm/value not essence
GSP.linkedContent: in late Husserl, [quasi-Hegelian teleological reason] movement of meaning can only be a norm/value not essence

CHM.content: all discourse, philosophy, must escape madness in fact/principle if it is to have intelligible meaning (discourse must carry normality w/in itself) > not a defect linked to determined historical structure but essential universal necessity > the meaning of meaning
CHM.linkedContent: all discourse, philosophy, must escape madness in fact/principle if it is to have intelligible meaning (discourse must carry normality w/in itself) > not a defect linked to determined historical structure but essential universal necessity > the meaning of meaning

CHM.content: phenomenological reduction as neutralizing, normalizing, straitjacketing (thematic of living present, profound reassurance of certainty of meaning)
CHM.linkedContent: phenomenological reduction as neutralizing, normalizing, straitjacketing (thematic of living present, profound reassurance of certainty of meaning)

REST.content: for Ferenczi, deviations (écarts) w/out essential norm [re: individual variants vs. universal symbols], supplements, overgarments, rain shoes, vaginas, sheath-effect
REST.linkedContent: for Ferenczi, deviations (écarts) w/out essential norm [re: individual variants vs. universal symbols], supplements, overgarments, rain shoes, vaginas, sheath-effect

REST.content: Heidegger & Shapiro bound themselves together to law of normal usage, the pair, ligatured worrying dismemberment in order to limit it: pair inhibits “fetishizing” movement, represses diabolical (i.e. a double, duplicity, w/out a pair)—pair rivets (rive) things to “normal” use
REST.linkedContent: Heidegger & Shapiro bound themselves together to law of normal usage, the pair, ligatured worrying dismemberment in order to limit it: pair inhibits “fetishizing” movement, represses diabolical (i.e. a double, duplicity, w/out a pair)—pair rivets (rive) things to “normal” use

HLP.content: w/out meta-interpretive norm not only difficult to define lie, fundamentally irreparable
HLP.linkedContent: w/out meta-interpretive norm not only difficult to define lie, fundamentally irreparable

LI.content: determination of “positive” values, the “standard (propre),” the non-parasitic, the literal is dogmatic: restricted interpretation of common sense never submitted to discussion
LI.linkedContent: determination of “positive” values, the “standard (propre),” the non-parasitic, the literal is dogmatic: restricted interpretation of common sense never submitted to discussion

LI.content: that which is “logically dependent” on the dogma is called pathology or decline (déchéance); for Derrida, this dogmatism is what psychoanalysis would call denial (dénégation)
LI.linkedContent: that which is “logically dependent” on the dogma is called pathology or decline (déchéance); for Derrida, this dogmatism is what psychoanalysis would call denial (dénégation)

LI.content: norms, stability, always provisional, finite; must account for stability as well as rules, norms, contractual possibilities that depend on it > to account for a certain stability, one that isn’t eternal, takes into account historicity, nonnaturalness of ethics, politics, institutionality
LI.linkedContent: norms, stability, always provisional, finite; must account for stability as well as rules, norms, contractual possibilities that depend on it > to account for a certain stability, one that isn’t eternal, takes into account historicity, nonnaturalness of ethics, politics, institutionality

CF.content: inherit a heritage w/ a double & contradictory injunction: reinvent memory w/out norm or criteria
CF.linkedContent: inherit a heritage w/ a double & contradictory injunction: reinvent memory w/out norm or criteria

LG.content: [after Derrida describes the double chiasmatic invagination of La folie du Jour] are all these transgressions permitted by [publishing] law, à l’intérieur de cet espace normé (normed space)? > but in La folie du jour “in whole and in part, the whole is a part (tout et partie , tout est partie)”
LG.linkedContent: [after Derrida describes the double chiasmatic invagination of La folie du Jour] are all these transgressions permitted by [publishing] law, à l’intérieur de cet espace normé (normed space)? > but in La folie du jour “in whole and in part, the whole is a part (tout et partie , tout est partie)”

OG.content: rigorous investigation beyond closure of knowledge, take positivity of science to its limits—monstrous, breaks absolutely w/ normality > faithful to l’avenir (for which there is yet no exergue [chapter title: exergue])
OG.linkedContent: rigorous investigation beyond closure of knowledge, take positivity of science to its limits—monstrous, breaks absolutely w/ normality > faithful to l’avenir (for which there is yet no exergue [chapter title: exergue])

SPEC.content: index of original normality [at this point of Beyond…] is the “primitive,” not child: primitives don’t face death [?], anxiety about death has no proper content
SPEC.linkedContent: index of original normality [at this point of Beyond…] is the “primitive,” not child: primitives don’t face death [?], anxiety about death has no proper content

SPEC.content: death is the analogon of castration > castration not incompatible w/ thesis of death drive if one refers to syntaxic articulation of athesis: Derrida’s pointing to “it” at this moment
SPEC.linkedContent: death is the analogon of castration > castration not incompatible w/ thesis of death drive if one refers to syntaxic articulation of athesis: Derrida’s pointing to “it” at this moment
